page.title: 16ECOLOGY 3
page.content: Woodland areas provide a third habitat even though it is no longer the natural woodland that once covered the area but is more recently planted areas of coniferous trees:the commonest being the Scots Pine.The plantations provide a home for a variety of birds especially the seed eaters like the goldcrest,crossbill and coal tit. In these three habitats can be found a large variety of birds both local and migratory (summer or winter) as can be seen from the following list: blackbird,buzzard, coal tit, collared dove,crossbill,crow,curlew,duck,gold crest,goose,greenshank,hen harrier, jackdaw,kestral,lapwing,magpie,oyster catcher,redshank,redwing,robin,rook, sand martin, skylark,swallow, swift, pied wagtail,wren and willow warbler. All these were seen in the early summe
